top_categories.workout_context: Iowa State Gravel TT Championship’s iowa rolling, state championship demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Iowa State Gravel TT Championship isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Iowa State Gravel TT Championship’s iowa rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Iowa State Gravel TT Championship rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Iowa State Gravel TT Championship’s iowa rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iowa State Gravel TT Championship. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on iowa rolling gravel.
The varied gradients at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Every session at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Iowa State Gravel TT Championship’s 40 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iowa State Gravel TT Championship requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa rolling, state championship, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 40 miles of iowa rolling gravel in Amana, Iowa.
